revised_title: Tide Observations and Measurements at Otaheite and Point Venus
tldr: This article describes the author's observations and measurements of tides at Otaheite (Tahiti) and Point Venus. The author explains the construction and use of tide gauges and tide battens to record high and low water levels. The study found that there were two irregular moments of high water during each 24-hour period, with a range of 10 AM to 2h 27m PM by day and 31 20m by night. The author also discusses the influence of sea and land breezes on tides.
